intro: Dorstenia ophiocoma f. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf false banana, is a member of the family Malvaceae and is native to Central America. It is a low-growing, herbaceous plant characterized by its fleshy, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental appeal, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in certain horticultural settings.
